posts.cooked:
We’re setting up a new laptop that will serve double (maybe triple?) duty as a driver station, programming machine, and CAD station.

We’ve already started installing all the usual suspects, and we’ll drop a screenshot of the desktop setup below.

image 1920×1089 67.7 KB

image 1920×1089 67.7 KB

image 1920×1089 67.7 KB

Before we call it “ready to go,” we wanted to ask: Are there any must-have apps or tools that your team always installs that we might’ve missed?

Almost everyone will recommend not having a dedicated driver station that also serves other functions if at all possible.

If you absolutely must, always use extenders for Ethernet and USB so you can maintain port life.

Make sure all power settings are set so it doesn’t turn off automatically.

Disable all Windows updates.

Akash_Rastogi:

Almost everyone will recommend not having a dedicated driver station that also serves other functions if at all possible.

We are also planning to get an dedicated drive station computer, but for now we got this computer to solve problems that may arise in the competition.  We will not install any applications that will bloat the computer that is not related to the FRC . Also thank you for your suggestions.

posts.name: Ty Galle
posts.cooked: That’s more than my team has for code and drive laptops (we use them somewhat interchangeably). The only thing I might recommend is getting Balena Etcher for microSD imaging, but I don’t if you already have a tool for that.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
baysal:

We will not install any applications that will bloat the computer that is not related to the FRC .

That makes the assumption that all software that is used for FRC doesn’t interfere with the driver station, which isn’t true. For example, this identifies autodesk software as interfering with the driver station: Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

See also Driver Station Best Practices — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: Known Issues — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
Driver Station Best Practices — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: bobbysq
posts.cooked: I would use Raspberry Pi Imager for that these days. BalenaEtcher still does the job as far as I know, but the Pi-specific features are nice to have.

posts.name: Ty Galle
posts.cooked: And, that works for things other than just a Pi-Imager? It works to image the roboRio 2.0?

posts.name: bobbysq
posts.cooked: It does! The official documentation even has instructions on how to do it. I’ve also used it to image a flash drive with a Linux ISO for an x86 PC.

link_counts.title: Imaging your roboRIO 2 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: We lost a match in the playoffs at the Istanbul Regional because we experienced the Warning 44000: Driver Station not keeping up with the protocol rate issue. When we asked the FTA about it, they brushed us off. Do you think an interfering app might have caused this problem?
